revision:
Trigonometric Ratios of Complementary Angles

  1. If the sum of two angles is 90 degrees than they are termed as complementary angles.
  2. sin (90\(^\circ\) - A) = cos A, cos (90\(^\circ\) - A) = sin A,
  3. tan (90\(^\circ\) - A) = cot A, cot (90\(^\circ\) - A) = tan A
  4. sec (90\(^\circ\) - A) = cosec A, cosec (90\(^\circ\) - A) = sec A
